sen.j: 株式会社京都アニメーション（きょうとアニメーション、英語表記：）はアニメーションの企画・製作およびアニメーション制作に関する技術指導を主な事業内容とする日本の企業である。
sen.e: Kyoto Animation Co., Ltd. is a Japanese corporation engaged in design and production of animation as well as in technical guidance in connection with production of animation.
Kyoto Animation Co., Ltd. is a Japanese corporation engaged in the design and production of animation as well as technical guidance related to animation production.
sen.cmt: Added "the"Deleted "in""in connection with production of animation" > "related to "
sen.e: Kyoto Animation Co., Ltd. is a Japanese corporation engaged in the design and production of animation as well as technical guidance related to animation production.

sen.j: 略称は「京アニ」。
sen.e: It is called "Kyo-ani" for short.
It is called "Kyo-ani" for short.
It is called 'Kyo-ani' for short.

sen.j: 1981年設立、1985年7月12日有限会社として法人化。
sen.e: It was founded in 1981 and incorporated as a limited private company on July 12, 1985.
Kyoto Animation was founded in 1981 and incorporated as a limited private company on July 12, 1985.
Kyoto Animation was founded in 1981 and incorporated as a limited private company on July 12, 1985.

sen.j: 1999年、株式会社に組織変更。
sen.e: It was reorganized into a stock company in 1999.
It was reorganized into a stock company in 1999.
It was reorganized into a stock company in 1999.

sen.j: 一部のポストプロダクション工程は社外で行う必要があるため、京都府宇治市の本社近郊とは別にオフィスを東京都港区 (東京都)に置く。
sen.e: The company has an office in Minato-ku, Tokyo, away from its head office in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture because some of post-production processes need to be handled outside.
The company has an office in Minato-ku, Tokyo, away from its head office in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture because some of post-production processes need to be handled outside of the company.
The company has an office in Minato Ward, Tokyo, away from its head office in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture because some of post-production processes need to be handled outside of the company.

sen.j: また、演出など一部のメインスタッフは、京都と東京を往復する事も多いと言われる。
sen.e: In addition, it is said that some main staff including producers frequently travel back and forth between Kyoto and Tokyo.
In addition, it is said that some main staff including producers frequently travel back and forth between Kyoto and Tokyo.
In addition, it is said that some main staff including producers frequently travel back and forth between Kyoto and Tokyo.

sen.j: 福利厚生として社宅を整備しており、自社のアニメスクールもある。
sen.e: Kyoto Animation offers company housing as part of a benefits package, and operates its own animation school.
Kyoto Animation offers company housing as part of a benefits package, and operates its own animation school.
Kyoto Animation offers company housing as part of a benefits package, and operates its own animation school.

sen.j: 2000年代において、もっとも注目を集めたアニメーション制作会社の一つであり、元請制作では『AIR (ゲーム)』 『CLANNAD (ゲーム)』のような美少女系をはじめ、『フルメタル・パニック!』シリーズのような本格ロボット物、『涼宮ハルヒの憂鬱』のような学園コメディー物、『らき☆すた』のようなギャグ作品に至るまで幅広くこなすなど、作品クオリティーには非常に高い定評がある。
sen.e: It is an animation production company which received much attention in 2000s, and is highly evaluated for the quality of its works, producing a wide variety of works of prime production including ones featuring pretty girls such as "AIR"(game) and "CLANNAD"(game), full-scale robot animation works such as "Full Metal Panic!" series, school comedies such as "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" and gag stories such as "Lucky Star."

The company received much attention in 2000s, and has been highly praised for the quality of its work, producing a wide variety of prime production works including those of the bishojo (beautiful young girl) genre such as "Air" and Clannad, full-scale robot animation works such as the "Full Metal Panic!" series, school comedies such as "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" and gag stories such as "Lucky Star."

The company received much attention in 2000s, and has been highly praised for the quality of its work, producing a wide variety of prime production works including those of the bishojo (beautiful young girl) genre such as "Air" and "Clannad", full-scale robot animation works such as the "Full Metal Panic!" series, school comedies such as "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" and gag stories such as "Lucky Star."

sen.j: 旧虫プロダクションで色彩設定仕上げ経験のある八田陽子が、1981年に近所の主婦らと、竜の子プロダクションやサンライズ (アニメ制作会社)の仕上げの仕事を始めた。
sen.e: Yoko HATTA, who had an experience of color setting in the former Mushi Production, began to undertake finishing work of Tatsunoko Production and Sunrise (animation production company) with housewives living in the neighborhood in 1981.

In 1981, Yoko HATTA, who had experience of color setting at the former Mushi Production studio, began to undertake finishing work at the Tatsunoko Production and Sunrise animation studios with local housewives.

In 1981, Yoko HATTA, who had experience of color setting at the former Mushi Production studio, began to undertake finishing work at the Tatsunoko Production and Sunrise animation studios with local housewives.

sen.j: 八田が結婚して移り住んだ京都府宇治市に由来して「京都アニメスタジオ」と名乗っていたが、のちに「京都アニメーション」に改称、夫の英明を社長に据え、1985年に有限会社として法人化される。
sen.e: HATTA called her business "Kyoto Anime Studio"in connection with Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture which she had moved into after marriage, but later she renamed it "Kyoto Animation" and incorporated it as a limited private company, appointing her husband Hideaki as president.

HATTA called her business "Kyoto Anime Studio" due to her move to Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture after getting married, but later she renamed it "Kyoto Animation" and incorporated it as a limited private company, appointing her husband Hideaki as president.

HATTA called her business 'Kyoto Anime Studio' due to her move to Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture after getting married, but later she renamed it 'Kyoto Animation' and incorporated it as a limited private company, appointing her husband Hideaki as president.

sen.j: 元は仕上げの工程を行う仕上専門会社であったが、1986年に作画部門を設立し他社の動画の下請けを始めている。
sen.e: The company was originally specialized in finishing process but it established Division of drawing in 1986 and started to undertake production of moving images from other companies.
The company originally specialized in the finishing process but it established a drawing department in 1986 and began to undertake production of animation for other companies.
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source.
sen.e: The company originally specialized in the finishing process but it established a drawing department in 1986 and began to undertake production of animation for other companies.

sen.j: 1987年のタツノコプロ制作のテレビアニメ『赤い光弾ジリオン』では、実質的な制作を行ったとされ、同作品のプロデューサー石川光久がアイジータツノコ（後のProduction I.G）を設立する際には出資を行った。
sen.e: It is believed that this company substantially took charge of production of a TV animation "Red Photon Zillion" produced by Tatsunoko Production in 1987, and it financed establishment of I.G. Tatsunoko (Production I.G) by Mitsuhisa ISHIKAWA, who had been a producer of "Red Photon Zillion."

It is thought that the company performed the actual production of the TV animation "Red Photon Zillion" produced by Tatsunoko Production in 1987, and that this production financed the establishment of I.G. Tatsunoko (which later became Production I.G) by Mitsuhisa ISHIKAWA, who had been the producer of "Red Photon Zillion."
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source.
sen.e: It is thought that the company performed the actual production of the TV animation "Red Photon Zillion" produced by Tatsunoko Production in 1987, and that this production financed the establishment of I.G. Tatsunoko (which later became Production I.G) by Mitsuhisa ISHIKAWA, who had been the producer of "Red Photon Zillion."

sen.j: やがて1990年代半ばから、演出・作画・仕上げ・背景・撮影などを自前で行う体制を整え、テレビアニメのグロス請けを行うようになった。
sen.e: The company established a framework for in-house staging, drawing, finishing, backgrounds and filming after mid-1990s and started to do gross subcontracting work of TV animations.
The company established a framework for in-house staging, drawing, finishing, backgrounds and filming after mid-1990s and started to perform the gross subcontracting work of TV animations.
The company established a framework for in-house staging, drawing, finishing, backgrounds and filming after mid-1990s and started to perform the gross subcontracting work of TV animations.

sen.j: 一時期4ヶ所のスタジオを構えた時期もあり、またゲームソフトのパッケージデザインやそのソフトに関連したコミック版も請け負っていた。
sen.e: It had four studios at one point, and undertook packaging design of game softwares and production of comics derived from the softwares.
It had four studios at one point, and was engaged in the packaging design for game software and the production of comics derived from these games.
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source.
sen.e: It had four studios at one point, and was engaged in the packaging design for game software and the production of comics derived from these games.

sen.j: 1992年にはシンエイ動画からの受注で、内田春菊原作のテレビアニメ『呪いのワンピース』を演出から仕上げまで初めて社内スタッフだけで制作した。
sen.e: At the order from Shin-ei animation, it produced a TV animation "Noroi-no-onepiece"based on a comic by Shungiku UCHIDA, and that was the first animation it produced all by its own staff, from staging to finishing.

Following an order from Shin-ei animation, Kyoto Animation produced the TV animation "Noroi-no-onepiece" based on the comic by Shungiku UCHIDA, and this was to be the first animation produced using entirely the company's own staff from staging to finishing.
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source.
sen.e: Following an order from Shin-ei animation, Kyoto Animation produced the TV animation "Noroi-no-one-piece" based on the comic by Shungiku UCHIDA, and this was to be the first animation produced using entirely the company's own staff from staging to finishing.

sen.j: この頃には既に質の高い仕事で評判になっていた。
sen.e: The company had gained a reputation for its high-quality work by this time.
By this time, the company had gained a reputation for its high-quality work.
By this time, the company had gained a reputation for its high-quality work.

sen.j: その後、長らく主要取引会社であるシンエイ動画、サンライズ (アニメ制作会社)、ぴえろなどの下請けを行った。
sen.e: After that, the company did subcontract work of Shin-ei animation, Sunrise (animation production company) and Piero Production which were its main clients.
Following this, the company did subcontract work for Shin-ei animation, Sunrise (animation production company) and Piero Production which were its main clients.
Following this, the company did subcontract work for Shin-ei animation, Sunrise (animation production company) and Piero Production which were its main clients.

sen.j: アニメ監督の杉井ギサブローによると、その評判から仕事の依頼が絶えず、発注する元請けの制作会社では、京都アニメーションに仕事を依頼するためにスケジュール調整を行うことがあったという。
sen.e: According to Gisaburo SUGII, an animation director, the company accepted a constant flow of orders because of its high reputation, and production companies which were prime contractors sometimes had to adjust their schedule only for the purpose of making a request to Kyoto Animation.

According to Gisaburo SUGII, an animation director, the company accepted a constant flow of orders because of its good reputation, and production companies which were prime contractors sometimes had to adjust their schedule only for the purpose of making a request to Kyoto Animation.

According to Gisaburo SUGII, an animation director, the company accepted a constant flow of orders because of its good reputation, and production companies which were prime contractors sometimes had to adjust their schedule only for the purpose of making a request to Kyoto Animation.

sen.j: 2003年、初の元請制作のテレビアニメ『フルメタル・パニック!フルメタル・パニック? ふもっふ』を制作し、2005年には『AIR (ゲーム)』を手がけた。
sen.e: The company produced a TV animation "Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu," its first prime production in 2003, and produced "AIR (game)" in 2005.
The company produced the TV animation "Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu," its first prime production in 2003, and produced "Air" in 2005.
The company produced the TV animation "Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu," its first prime production in 2003, and produced "Air" in 2005.

sen.j: AIRは当時のアニメ界としては、他を圧倒するほどの作り込みと巧みな演出が話題を呼び、京都アニメーションの名はアニメファンの間でブランド化した。
sen.e: "AIR" was much talked about in the world of animation in those days because of an unsurpassed level of elaboration and sophisticated staging, and the name of Kyoto Animation became a brand among fans of animation.

"Air" was much talked about within the animation industry at the time because of its unsurpassed level of elaboration and sophisticated staging, and the name Kyoto Animation became a brand among animation.

"Air" was much talked about within the animation industry at the time because of its unsurpassed level of elaboration and sophisticated staging, and the name Kyoto Animation became a brand among animation.

sen.j: 以後、自社元請制作に専念するようになり、『AIR』以降、ゲームブランドKeyが製作した恋愛アドベンチャーゲームをテレビアニメ化し、『Kanon (ゲーム)』、『CLANNAD (ゲーム)』、『CLANNAD 〜AFTER STORY〜』と毎年1作ずつ制作している。
sen.e: After that, the company started to dedicate itself to its own prime production and made TV animation out of romantic adventure games produced by Key, a game brand, including "Kanon (game)," "CLANNAD (game)," and "CLANNAD〜AFTER STORY〜," at a rate of one animation per year.

The company went on to dedicate itself to its own prime productions and, after the production of "Air," adapted created animated TV adaptations of romantic adventure games produced by the Key game brand including "Kanon," "Clannad" and "Clannad After Story" at a rate of one animation per year.
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source.
sen.e: The company went on to dedicate itself to its own prime productions and, after the production of "Air," adapted created animated TV adaptations of romantic adventure games produced by the Key game brand including "Kanon," "Clannad" and "Clannad After Story" at a rate of one animation per year.

sen.j: 同じく2005年、フルメタル・パニックシリーズの続編『フルメタル・パニック!フルメタル・パニック! The Second Raid』を制作し、これもヒットした。
sen.e: Also in 2005, the company produced "Full Metal Panic! Full Metal Panic! The Second Raid," a sequel to the Full Metal Panic series, which also became a hit.
Also in 2005, the company produced "Full Metal Panic! The Second Raid," a sequel to the Full Metal Panic series, which also became a hit.
sen.cmt: Deleted one instance of "Full Metal Panic!"
sen.e: Also in 2005, the company produced "Full Metal Panic! The Second Raid," a sequel to the Full Metal Panic series, which also became a hit.

sen.j: さらに2006年の『涼宮ハルヒの憂鬱 (アニメ)』は同年上半期最高の話題作となり、2007年放送した『らき☆すた (アニメ)』も『涼宮ハルヒの憂鬱』同様、ヒット作となっている。
sen.e: Furthermore, "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya (animation)" in 2006 became the most popular work in the first half year, and "Lucky Star (animation)," which was got on the air in 2007, was as great a hit as "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya."

Furthermore, the 2006 animation "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" became the most popular work of the first half of year, and "Lucky Star," which was broadcast in 2007, was as great a hit as "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya."
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source.
sen.e: Furthermore, the 2006 animation "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" became the most popular work of the first half of year, and "Lucky Star," which was broadcast in 2007, was as great a hit as "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya."

sen.j: 2009年に『となりの801ちゃん』を制作する予定だったが、諸般の事情で中止になった。
sen.e: The company planned to produce "Tonari no 801-chan" in 2009, but the plan was cancelled due to various factors.
The company planned to produce "Tonari no 801-chan" in 2009, but the plan was cancelled due to various factors.
The company planned to produce "Tonari no 801-chan" in 2009, but the plan was cancelled due to various factors.

sen.j: 制作体制
sen.e: Production system
Production System
Production System

sen.j: 地方プロダクションであり近場に外注を出せる制作会社が無い事もあって、演出、作画、仕上げ、美術、撮影、デジタルエフェクトまでのプロダクション作業を社内で行なえる体制を構築しており、外注による分業体制を取るプロダクションに対して、スタッフのコミュニケーションが密に取れることが特徴となっている。
sen.e: Being a local production with no production companies nearby to outsource to, this company has established systems capable of in-house production processes including staging, drawing, finishing, art, filming and digital effects, so that one of its characteristics is close communication among its staff compared with productions which establish division of labor through outsourcing.

Being a local studio with no production companies nearby to outsource to, Kyoto Animation has established systems capable of in-house production processes including staging, drawing, finishing, art, filming and digital effects, so that one of its characteristics is the close communication among its staff compared with studios which establish division of labor through outsourcing.

Being a local studio with no production companies nearby to outsource to, Kyoto Animation has established systems capable of in-house production processes including staging, drawing, finishing, art, filming and digital effects, so that one of its characteristics is the close communication among its staff compared with studios which establish division of labor through outsourcing.

sen.j: 作画・仕上げ・美術の工程を国内の複数社に委託することは少なく（作画は関西の制作会社、美術は『CLANNAD』制作時に、『涼宮ハルヒの憂鬱』『らき☆すた』で美術監督を務めた田村せいきが所属するアニメ工房婆娑羅に発注することがあった）、編集・音響を除く工程の一部が子会社のアニメーションDoならびに協力会社の大韓民国のアニメスタジオ「Studio Blue（旧：Ani Village）」よって賄われている。
sen.e: It seldom subcontracts the processes of drawing, finishing and art to several domestic companies (The process of drawing is sometimes subcontracted to a production company in Kansai region, and during production of "CLANNAD" the process of art was subcontracted to the animation atelier Barasa, to which Seiki TAMURA, an art director of "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" and "Lucky Star," belongs.) and some processes other than editing and audio are handled by its subsidiary Animation Do and its cooperative animation studio "Studio Blue (formerly, Ani Village)" in Republic of Korea.

It occasionally subcontracts the processes of drawing, finishing and art to several domestic companies (the process of drawing is sometimes subcontracted to a production company in the Kansai region, and during production of "Clannad" the process of art was subcontracted to Basara animation studio to which Seiki TAMURA, the art director of "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" and "Lucky Star," belongs) and some processes other than editing and audio are handled by its subsidiary Animation Do and its cooperative animation studio "Studio Blue (formerly, Ani Village)" in the Republic of Korea.

It occasionally subcontracts the processes of drawing, finishing and art to several domestic companies (the process of drawing is sometimes subcontracted to a production company in the Kansai region, and during production of "Clannad" the process of art was subcontracted to Basara animation studio to which Seiki TAMURA, the art director of "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" and "Lucky Star," belongs) and some processes other than editing and audio are handled by its subsidiary Animation Do and its cooperative animation studio 'Studio Blue' (formerly, Ani Village) in the Republic of Korea.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更し、()を' 'の外に移動させました。

sen.j: 現在のところ、他社へのグロス出しは『フルメタル・パニック? ふもっふ』を除いて行われていない。
sen.e: For the present, it never subcontracts gross to other companies except in the case of "Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu."
At present, it has never subcontracts gross to other companies except in the case of "Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu."
At present, it has never subcontracts gross to other companies except in the case of "Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu."

sen.j: スタッフ
sen.e: Staff
Staff
Staff

sen.j: ゲーム作品（ここではKey作品）のアニメ化にあたっては、強制ではないがアニメを制作するスタッフ全員で原作ゲームをプレイしている。
sen.e: When the company is about to make a game (produced by Key) into animation, all the staff engaged in production of animation play the original game, though they are not forced to.
Before the company adapts a game (produced by Key) into an animation, all of the staff to be engaged in its production play the original game, although they are not forced to do so.
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source.
sen.e: Before the company adapts a game (produced by Key) into an animation, all of the staff to be engaged in its production play the original game, although they are not forced to do so.

sen.j: 設定制作、制作進行をそれぞれ「設定マネージャー」「制作マネージャー」と呼称する。
sen.e: The staff responsible for establishment of production and production management are called "a establish manager"and "a production manager"respectively.
The staff responsible for the establishment of production and production management are called the "Establishment Manager" and "Production Manager" respectively.
The staff responsible for the establishment of production and production management are called the 'Establishment Manager' and 'Production Manager' respectively.

sen.j: 社屋
sen.e: Premise
Premises
Premises

sen.j: 本社屋にスキャン・動画検査などを行うデジタル映像開発室を備える。
sen.e: The headquarters building has a digital imaging development section in charge of scanning and inspection of moving pictures.
The headquarters building has a digital imaging development section in charge of the scanning and inspection of moving pictures.
The headquarters building has a digital imaging development section in charge of the scanning and inspection of moving pictures.

sen.j: デジタルペイント・作画などの作業は別棟スタジオにて行われる。
sen.e: Digital painting and drawing are handled in studios located in another building.
Digital painting and drawing are handled in studios located in another building.
Digital painting and drawing are handled in studios located in another building.

sen.j: 『らき☆すた』の21話において、主人公達が同社を訪れた際、「作品数を絞っているので本社の見た目は普通の建物ぐらいでいい」という会話をしていた。
sen.e: When the main characters of "Lucky Star" visited Kyoto Animation in its twenty-first episode, they said "As this company limits the number of works it produces, it needs a head office only as large as normal buildings" in their conversation.

When the main characters of "Lucky Star" visited Kyoto Animation in its twenty-first episode, they said "This company only needs a headquarters the size of regular building because it limits how much it produces."

When the main characters of "Lucky Star" visited Kyoto Animation in its twenty-first episode, they said 'This company only needs a headquarters the size of regular building because it limits how much it produces.'
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 2008年2月、京都市伏見区桃山町（宇治市六地蔵との境界付近）に建設していた新スタジオ（第1スタジオ）が完成した。
sen.e: In February 2008, a new studio (the first studio), which had been under construction in Momoyama-cho, Fushimi-ku, Kyoto City (near the boundary with Rokujizou, Uji City), was completed.
In February 2008, a new studio (the first studio), which had been under construction in Momoyama-cho, Fushimi-ku, Kyoto City (near the boundary with Rokujizou, Uji City), was completed.
In February 2008, a new studio (the first studio), which had been under construction in Momoyama Town, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City (near the boundary with Rokujizo, Uji City), was completed.
sen.cmt: choをtownに、kuをWardに変更しました。RokujizouをRokujizoに変更しました。

sen.j: 2008年度以降は2005年に完成した宇治市内の本社と、本社から徒歩圏内にあるスタジオ（第2スタジオ）とともに、一駅で行ける新スタジオでもアニメーション制作を行っている。
sen.e: After the fiscal year 2008, animation is produced in a new studio located one station away from the head office, as well as in the head office which had been completed within Uji City in 2005 and a studio (the second studio) accessible on foot from the head office.

Since the 2008 fiscal year, animation has been produced in a new studio located one station away from the headquarters, as well as at the headquarters which had been completed in Uji City in 2005 and a studio (the second studio) accessible on foot from the head office.

Since the 2008 fiscal year, animation has been produced in a new studio located one station away from the headquarters, as well as at the headquarters which had been completed in Uji City in 2005 and a studio (the second studio) accessible on foot from the head office.

sen.j: ハイビジョン対応
sen.e: High-definition
High-definition
High-definition

sen.j: マスタリング時点で『涼宮ハルヒの憂鬱』までは、ハイビジョン制作には非対応だった為、16:9の標準画質映像（Standard Definition：SD）画質で制作していた。
sen.e: "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" and older works were non-HD-compliant at the time of mastering, and they were produced as a 16:9 SD (Standard Definition) video.
"The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" and older works were non-HD-compliant at the time of mastering, and they were produced in 16:9 SD (Standard Definition).
"The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" and older works were non-HD-compliant at the time of mastering, and they were produced in 16:9 SD (Standard Definition).

sen.j: そのため2005年にBS-TBSで放送され、2006年にはBlu-ray Discで発売されるなど高精細度ビデオ（High Definition：HD）での映像フォーマットが使用された『AIR』でも、SDで制作しアップコンバートでHD化したものであった。
sen.e: Thus "AIR," broadcast on BS-TBS in 2005 and released in the form of Blu-ray Disc in 2006 with the use of the video format of High Definition, were produced as an SD video and upconverted into an HD video.
Therefore "Air," which used high definition video formats for its broadcast on BS-TBS in 2005 and release on Blu-ray Disc in 2006, were produced in SD video and converted into HD video.
Therefore "Air," which used high definition video formats for its broadcast on BS-TBS in 2005 and release on Blu-ray Disc in 2006, were produced in SD video and converted into HD video.

sen.j: HDでの制作は2006年の『Kanon』からであるが、BS-iはHDの素材をSDにダウンコンバートした後、HDにアップコンバートしなおしたものを放送した。
sen.e: Kyoto Animation started to produce HD videos after "Kanon" in 2006, but BS-I downconverted HD videos into SD ones and upconverted them into HD ones again before putting them on the air.
Kyoto Animation began producing HD video after "Kanon" in 2006, but BS-I converted HD video into SD video and reconverted them into HD video again before broadcasting them.
Kyoto Animation began producing HD video after "Kanon" in 2006, but BS-I converted HD video into SD video and reconverted them into HD video again before broadcasting them.

sen.j: HDのまま放送しないのはDVDの売り上げ増や、次世代DVDが普及した後にHDリマスター版で再び売り出す事を狙ったものと言われており、故意に画質を落とし放送するのはTBS（および子会社のBS-i）で多用される手法である（その一方で系列局の毎日放送（MBS）や中部日本放送（CBC）制作作品では近年になってHDマスターでの放映を実施している）。
sen.e: It is said that they do not broadcast an HD video as it is because they try to increase the sales of DVDs, or because they are planning to release the HD remastered version again after diffusion of the next-generation DVD, and broadcasting of videos which have been intentionally degraded is a method frequently used by TBS (and its subsidiary, BS-i). (On the other hand, works produced by Mainichi Broadcasting System, Inc. (MBS) and Chubu-Nippon Broadcasting Co., Ltd.(CBC), which are affiliates of TBS, are being broadcast in the HD master version these days.)

It is said that they do not broadcast in HD video in an attempt to increase DVD sales, or because they are planning to release the HD remastered versions again after the widespread adoption of next-generation DVD, and the broadcasting of videos which have been intentionally degraded is a method frequently used by TBS (and its subsidiary, BS-i) (on the other hand, works produced by Mainichi Broadcasting System, Inc. (MBS) and Chubu-Nippon Broadcasting Co., Ltd. (CBC), which are affiliates of TBS, have been broadcast in the HD master versions in recent years).
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source.
sen.e: It is said that they do not broadcast in HD video in an attempt to increase DVD sales, or because they are planning to release the HD remastered versions again after the widespread adoption of next-generation DVD, and the broadcasting of videos which have been intentionally degraded is a method frequently used by TBS (and its subsidiary, BS-i) (on the other hand, works produced by Mainichi Broadcasting System, Inc. (MBS) and Chubu-Nippon Broadcasting Co., Ltd. (CBC), which are affiliates of TBS, have been broadcast in the HD master versions in recent years).

sen.j: 原作の再現度
sen.e: Reproduction of the original
Reproduction of Original Works
Reproduction of Original Works

sen.j: 元請制作作品は『空を見上げる少女の瞳に映る世界』を除き、アドベンチャーゲーム（Key作品）・ライトノベル・コミックなどを原作としているが、それらの作品はいずれも基本は原作に忠実であり、その上でサプライズ的な要素を付加させるといったストーリー展開を貫いている（『涼宮ハルヒの憂鬱』では原作小説の地の文まで再現している）。
sen.e: Works of the company's own prime production (except for "Sora o Miageru Shoujo no Hitomi ni Utsuru Sekai (World reflected in the eyes of a girl gazing up the sky)") were based on adventure games (produced by Key), light novels and comics, and they were basically true to the original storyline with some surprising factors added. (In "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" even the text of the original novel was reproduced.)

All of Kyoto Animation's own prime productions (except for "Sora o Miageru Shoujo no Hitomi ni Utsuru Sekai" (The World Reflected in the Eyes of a Girl Looking Up at the Heavens)) are based on adventure games (produced by Key), light novels and comics, and they were basically true to the original storylines with some surprise elements added (in "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" even the text of the original novel was reproduced).
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source.
sen.e: All of Kyoto Animation's own prime productions (except for "Sora wo Miageru Shojo no Hitomi ni Utsuru Sekai" (The World Reflected in the Eyes of a Girl Looking Up at the Heavens)) are based on adventure games (produced by Key), light novels and comics, and they were basically true to the original storylines with some surprise elements added (in "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" even the text of the original novel was reproduced).
sen.cmt: oをwoに、ShoujoをShojoに変更しました。

sen.j: 『AIR』『Kanon』『CLANNAD』は東映アニメーションもアニメ版を制作しているが、東映が独自の解釈でオリジナル要素が強いのに対し、京都アニメーションでは原作に忠実な点が高く評価される一因となっている。
sen.e: Though "AIR," "Kanon" and "CLANNAD" were made into animation by Toei Animation as well, the Kyoto Animation versions are true to the original and more highly evaluated than the Toei Animation versions, which featured exclusive factors based on Toei's specific interpretation.

Although "Air," "Kanon" and "Clannad" were also adapted into animations by Toei Animation, the Kyoto Animation versions are true to the original and more highly praised than the Toei Animation versions, which featured original elements based on Toei's own interpretations.
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source.
sen.e: Although "Air," "Kanon" and "Clannad" were also adapted into animations by Toei Animation, the Kyoto Animation versions are true to the original and more highly praised than the Toei Animation versions, which featured original elements based on Toei's own interpretations.

sen.j: ストーリー以外でも、原作のCGやイラストと近い作画を制作し、Key作品においては原作に使用されている主題歌・BGMを多用している。
sen.e: In addition to storylines, Kyoto Animation produces drawing very similar to the original CGs and illustrations, and uses a large number of theme songs and BGMs used in the original in the case of works produced by Key.

In addition to storylines, Kyoto Animation produces drawings very similar to the CG and illustrations of original works, and with regard to Key adaptations, uses a large number of the theme songs and background music used in the original games.

In addition to storylines, Kyoto Animation produces drawings very similar to the CG and illustrations of original works, and with regard to Key adaptations, uses a large number of the theme songs and background music used in the original games.

sen.j: 2000年4月7日に京都アニメーション大阪スタジオを法人化し、新たに設立された関連会社として「アニメーションDo（商号：有限会社アニメーションドゥウ）」がある。
sen.e: "Animation Do (trade name: Animation Do Ltd.)" is a newly-established subsidiary of Kyoto Animation by incorporating its Osaka studio on April 7, 2000.
"Animation Do (trade name: Animation Do Ltd.)" is a newly-established subsidiary of Kyoto Animation formed by incorporating its Osaka studio on April 7, 2000.
Animation Do' (trade name: Animation Do Ltd.) is a newly-established subsidiary of Kyoto Animation formed by incorporating its Osaka studio on April 7, 2000.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更し、()を' 'の外に移動させました。

sen.j: 大阪府大阪市中央区 (大阪市)にオフィスを構える。
sen.e: This company has an office in Chuo-ku, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.
The company has an office in Chuo-ku, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.
The company has an office in Chuo Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 独自にシンエイ動画から『あたしンち』『ジャングルはいつもハレのちグゥ』などを請ける他は、京都アニメーションが請ける作品の作画を協力することが主な業務だった。
sen.e: The main activity of this company was cooperation for drawing of the works undertaken by Kyoto Animation, with the exception of "Atashin'chi" and "Jungle wa itsumo Hale nochi Guu"independently subcontracted by Shin-ei animation.

The main activity of this company was to cooperate in creating drawings for works undertaken by Kyoto Animation in addition to works independently subcontracted by Shin-ei animation such as "Atashin'chi" and "Jungle wa itsumo Hale nochi Guu."

The main activity of this company was to cooperate in creating drawings for works undertaken by Kyoto Animation in addition to works independently subcontracted by Shin-ei animation such as "Atashin'chi" and "Jungle wa itsumo Hale nochi Guu."

sen.j: 京都アニメーションが自社元請け制作に一本化してからは、同社のグロス請けに専念。
sen.e: Since Kyoto Animation started to dedicate itself to its own prime production, Animation Do has been devoted to gross subcontract from Kyoto Animation.
As Kyoto Animation has dedicated itself to its own prime productions, Animation Do has been devoted to the gross subcontract of Kyoto Animation.
As Kyoto Animation has dedicated itself to its own prime productions, Animation Do has been devoted to the gross subcontract of Kyoto Animation.

sen.j: 立場上としては京都アニメーションの事業所の一つとなっている。
sen.e: Its position has become that of an office of Kyoto Animation.
Its position has become that of an office of Kyoto Animation.
Its position has become that of an office of Kyoto Animation.

sen.j: そのため、劇場版『クレヨンしんちゃん (アニメ)』では、アニメーションDoのスタッフも京都アニメーションの一員としてクレジットされている（テレビシリーズでは設立後も京都アニメーション名義）。
sen.e: That is why the staff of Animation Do were featured as members of Kyoto Animation in the credit title of the theatrical film "Crayon Shinchan (animation)." (In the TV animation series Animation Do is treated as part of Kyoto Animation even after its incorporation.)

It is for this reason that Animation Do staff were credited as members of Kyoto Animation in the theatrical film "Crayon Shinchan" (in the TV animation series, Animation Do is treated as part of Kyoto Animation even after its incorporation.).

It is for this reason that Animation Do staff were credited as members of Kyoto Animation in the theatrical film "Crayon Shinchan" (in the TV animation series, Animation Do is treated as part of Kyoto Animation even after its incorporation.).

sen.j: 基本的に、原作がゲームブランドKeyの作品と、原作がライトノベル・漫画である角川書店の作品を交互にアニメ化させている。
sen.e: Basically animations are made from the games produced by Key, a game brand, and from the light novels and comics published by Kadokawa Group Publishing Co., Ltd in alternate shifts.
Kyoto Animation animations are essentially alternately adapted from games produced by the game studio Key and light novels and comics published by Kadokawa Group Publishing Co., Ltd.
Kyoto Animation animations are essentially alternately adapted from games produced by the game studio Key and light novels and comics published by Kadokawa Group Publishing Co., Ltd.

sen.j: Key作品のアニメ化にあたっては、Keyファンであり『AIR (ゲーム)』アニメ化の話を持ち込んだアニメーション脚本家の志茂文彦が脚本を勤め、同じくKeyファンで京アニの主監督を勤める石原立也がタッグを組んで制作を行っている。
sen.e: When the works of Key are made into animation, Fumihiko SHIMO, a fan of Key and animation writer who proposed to make "AIR (game)" into animation, writes a script, and Tatsuya ISHIHARA, who is also a fan of Key and main director of Kyo-ani, takes charge of production pairing with SHIMO.

When a Key game is adapted into an animation, Fumihiko SHIMO, a fan of Key and the animation scriptwriter who proposed making an animated adaptation of "AIR," writes the script, and Tatsuya ISHIHARA, who is also a fan of Key and the main director at Kyo-ani, teams up with Shimo and takes charge of production.

When a Key game is adapted into an animation, Fumihiko SHIMO, a fan of Key and the animation scriptwriter who proposed making an animated adaptation of "AIR," writes the script, and Tatsuya ISHIHARA, who is also a fan of Key and the main director at Kyo-ani, teams up with Shimo and takes charge of production.

sen.j: なお『フルメタル・パニック!』の原作者・賀東招二と関係が深く、アニメ『涼宮ハルヒの憂鬱』の放送順第11話「射手座の日」、『らき☆すた』の第5話「名射手」、第12話「お祭りへいこう」、第22話「ここにある彼方」の脚本は賀東が担当した。
sen.e: Kyoto Animation has close ties with Shoji GATO, the original author of "Full Metal Panic!," and he wrote scripts of "The Day of Sagittarius,"the eleventh episode (in the order of airing) of "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya (animation)," "A Good Archer" (the fifth episode), "Let's Go to the Festival" (the twelfth episode) and "Kokoni aru Kanata"(the twenty-second episode) of "Lucky Star."

Kyoto Animation has close ties with Shoji GATO, the original author of "Full Metal Panic!," and he wrote scripts for "The Day of Sagittarius," eleventh episode (in the order of airing) of "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya (animation)," "A Good Archer" (the fifth episode), "Let's Go to the Festival" (twelfth episode) and "Kokoni aru Kanata "the twenty-second episode) of "Lucky Star."

Kyoto Animation has close ties with Shoji GATO, the original author of "Full Metal Panic!," and he wrote scripts for "The Day of Sagittarius," eleventh episode (in the order of airing) of "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" (animation), 'A Good Archer' (the fifth episode), 'Let's Go to the Festival' (twelfth episode) and 'Kokoni aru Kanata' the twenty-second episode) of "Lucky Star."
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更し、()を' 'や" "の外に移動させました。

sen.j: 『涼宮ハルヒの憂鬱』の放送順第9話「サムデイインザレイン」は、アニメ版オリジナルエピソードを原作者の谷川流が書き下ろし、脚本まで担当している。
sen.e: In "Someday in the Rain," the ninth episode (in the order of airing) of "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya," the original author Nagaru TANIGAWA created a new story especially for the animation and wrote the script as well.

In "Someday in the Rain," the ninth episode (in the order of airing) of "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya," the original author Nagaru TANIGAWA created a new story especially for the animation and wrote the script as well.

In 'Someday in the Rain,' the ninth episode (in the order of airing) of "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya," the original author Nagaru TANIGAWA created a new story especially for the animation and wrote the script as well.
